name: Ibis Amsterdam City Stopera

reviews.text: Front desk was great with info and help. Never much of a wait.
reviews.title: Fine stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Availability of computer with a printer helped with tickets and boarding passes.
reviews.title: Surprisingly good

reviews.text: Lack of fridge and coffee/tea maker a drawback for those with dietary issues. When restaurant food and beverages need to be specially selected, these items are a must, and add little to the cost
reviews.title: Could be better.

reviews.text: When you book a room at the Ibis, you know what you get, the rooms look about the same all over the world, but Ibis Amsterdam City Stopera suprised me in a good way. Perfectly located not that far from the city center and train station. Comfortable bed with a perfect pillow. We had a late flight but we could store our luggage at the hotel after check out.
reviews.title: Ibis Stopera

reviews.text: The room was small and the furniture looked like it came from IKEA. The bath room looked like one on a cruise ship. The location was close to the center of Amsterdam but the street where the hotel was located was kind of run down. We had the breakfast included in our package and it had a good variety and was worth the money.
reviews.title: Excellent value, clean and central.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here end of august/beginning sept 2007 for 4 nights. The rooms - yes they are fairly basic but for the price I can only praise the Ibis. The ensuites are like little 'pods' but are ingenius and have a fantastic walk in shower.
reviews.title: Perfect for us...great value

reviews.text: We looked onto a canal which I definitely suggest asking for if they can accommodate this.
reviews.title: Nicely located hotel to explore Amsterdam

likes.disliked: — No tea or coffee facility. The luggage store is not locked.

reviews.text: The staff were nothing short of excellent therefore if you have any problems you always have help at hand.
reviews.title: Basic (VERY basic) accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was plentiful - with hot and continental breakfast.
reviews.title: Excellent choice for weekend break

likes.liked: — Value for money in an expensive city

reviews.text: About a 10-15 min walk from the centre - which we don't mind - but you seem to be there in no time at all. Definitely worth a short walk to save quite a substantial amount of money.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Getting there;
reviews.title: Good Hotel
Would definitely "Stopera" again!!!!!
reviews.text: If arriving at Amsterdam Central, just get the metro 2 stops to Waterlooplein Stn ( they all go to this one ) cost Euro 1.60. approx 5 min walk easy to find.
Hotel;
reviews.title: One night in Amsterdam

likes.disliked: — It was expensive but then Amsterdam is expensive...

reviews.text: Modern on main street, quick check in, provided with keycard for access to lift and room. Rooms modern, clean and have tv, aircon/heating. The shower room is great and consists sink,toilet and an amazing large walk in shower.
reviews.title: Clean and good hotel..quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast if its included in your deal is comprehensive, hotel has vending machines.
reviews.title: Great Location , Clean

reviews.text: After searching through hundreds of other hotels online i finally decided on the stopera. must say was very impressed. althought fairly small rooms, they were clean and warm, bed was very comfortable and the shower was just divine-couldve stayed in it all day. its closer to town than it appears and there is really no need for trams as its a five minute walk to town and 10 min walk to dam square. really ejoyed coming back here at the end of the day as knew would have a lovely sleep. didnt have the breakfast but does seem a little pricey-just walk into town anywhere to find cheaper alternative. overall with this hotel you know exactly what you're getting and its fairly cheap for being so close to town. recommended.
reviews.title: good hotel, good price

reviews.text: I stayed at the Ibis Stopera last summer, after another booking fell through. I was pleased both with the rate and the room. It was close to everything, and there was a tram stop about two blocks south of the hotel. My room had a lovely view out over the canal behind the hotel, and was large by European standards. The staff was outstanding, and I had a great time chatting with the barman. As a single woman travelling alone, I found it to be safe, quiet, and very clean. I would and have recommended it to friends.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at the Ibis Stopera for 5 nights from 28 Dec 05 - 3 Jan 06. Like most hotels in Amsterdam during this period the Ibis was booked solid. The last 3-star hotel I stayed at was the Avenue (single room) and I had not been impressed. I was very pleased with our choice this time. The location is great and much closer to Dam square and Central station than I was expecting. It was far enough away from the hustle and bustle to be relaxing and quite peaceful (discounting the unavoidable NYE crackers!), yet close enough to comfortably walk almost everywhere. It was always cold and sometimes snowing during our stay yet we never bothered with trams or taxis and walked everywhere with ease. The rooms are cosy and comfortable. They're not big rooms but they're big enough for two adults and they're modern and clean. At all times we found the staff to be enthusiastic, pleasant, helpful and efficient and all had perfect English. They seemed to be quite a young crew, always well groomed and we thought they did a great job considering they were dealing with a full hotel of mainly other young people who were in Amsterdam for NYE party celebrations (as were we - though not so young!). Yes, as other reviewers have mentioned, noise from the corridor is evident although we found it to only ever be momentary and never found it to be a source of disturbance. Our only complaint would be the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room. We knew this to be the case when we booked and thought it wouldn't matter, but once there we really missed this facility and also missed the convenience of a mini-fridge. The Ibis Stopera was great value for money and offers the security of "what you see on the website is what you get". I would recommend it to all, but I think I missed having a kettle and a fridge a bit too much and will probably look for a different hotel next time just so as to have those facilities.
reviews.title: Vaule for money
Great stay
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night, as Ibis Central Station was booked. The room was neat and clean. We had a great view overlooking the canal. The bathroom at Ibis Stopera was much nicer than the one at Central Station. The front desk employees were wonderfully pleasant. I'm picky and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again! It was an overall great experience!!
Very nice, stayed in the back block (2 blocks) room was a standard IBIS room, was kept clean and well presented. Staff spoke good english.
reviews.title: Good Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is excellent located, 10-15 minutes from Central Station, from The Red Light District also, and 5 minutes from Nemo - a great experience especially if you have kids. The staff is very friendly, the breakfast is good, the rooms are small but you have enough space. The view from our room was extraordinary because we stayed at the ground floor with the canal view. I recomend this hotel and for sure I will stay here again when I wil return to Amsterdam!
reviews.title: Very good choice

reviews.text: Spent two nights here, when meeting friends from Japan and Brazil. Room and bathroom was nice and clean. Bathroom a bit small, but it was big enough for me. Friendly helpful staff. Didn`t have breakfast in the hotel. Booked airport shuttle from the hotel, but it was late. Receptionist called and ask the reason for the delay. Fortunately we had booked an earlier shuttle than neccesairy, so we arrived in time for the departures.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: friendly staff.. great location, rooms are small and basic as with all IBIS but clean nonetheless. good for group or friends..cheap deals on the hotel website. got 3 nights for 100 euro cheaper than on booking.com! would stay here again.
reviews.title: great value

reviews.text: Room booked here by my company for my stay during IBC 2007. The hotel's web site self-describes this as a 3-star hotel but I would say that 2 stars is more accurate. The good: clean room, lovely shower, friendly staff, okay location. The bad: room is tiny, missing even the most basic amenities (no clock, tissue, wash cloths, ironing board, coffee maker), intermittent outages on expensive wireless internet, weird building layout, concrete floor covered with indoor-outdoor carpet, bathrooom door is spring loaded and can't be propped open, minimal closet space, no drawers (but there are some shelves). I'm going to be here for a week so I was hoping for something a bit more comfortable. Certainly, it could be worse, and it is definitely clean and well-maintained ... just a bit more basic than I was expecting. Amsterdam is frightfully expensive for Americans due to weak dollar relative to Euro (1 EU = $1.36 as I write this).
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.text: Good location with comfortable and quiet accommodations. The shower was exceptional. Note: they do not have wash clothes, or shampoo and conditioner. This was disappointing. Still, this hotel is a very good choice for a visit to this fun-filled city. The staff were helpful and friendly, which contributed to a memorable experience. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an affordable, clean, and safe hotel.
reviews.title: Above average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Ibis Stopera for 3 nights in September 2006. The hotel was in a good location within walking distance of all the main sights in Amsterdam. The room and bathroom were a good size and very clean. I cannot comment on the food in the hotel as we always ate out as the resturant had high prices compared to other places. I would definity recommend this hotel to anyone going to Amsterdam as it is very reasonable priced compared to other hotels.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Super Stopera
reviews.text: Just returned from the Stopera, I really liked this hotel. Good sized rooms, very helpful and friendly staff and a good breakfast. Ideal for a short break.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely canal view for our room. Shower was excellent and a good size. TV had a good selection of English channels - BBC 1 and 2.
reviews.title: Amsterdam is great!!

likes.liked: — It was close to the centre of Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were very friendly and helped us with table reservations and taxi bookings.
reviews.title: Impressed with The Stopera

reviews.text: Just returned from Holland. Stayed 2 nights at Ibis Amsterdam Stopera. Terrible experience. Never ever again.
reviews.title: Best avoid unless heavy smoker

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel through Ibis website. Paid Euro 178.5 for 2 nights. Before booking it, I have gone through reviews on Tripadviser. I chose it because of its location and price range. I booked a non-smoking rooom for 2 nights. We checked in around 2pm. The room was stink!! like a hevey smoker room. The room faced a main road. Either we opened the window trying to get rid of the smell, but noise from the main road or we had a peace and quiet night, but hold our breath as long as possible. We went to talk to receptionist, but we were told 'there was not non-smoking room available. This was rather strange considering checking in time 2pm onwards and we checked in 2.30pm. I thought that perhaps it was full, ok, fair enought.The following morning, we contacted the receptionist again. This time the staff said that there was not non-smoking room in this hotel! Is it possibile? The staff did not offer any help, neither friendly. they looked us as if we were the one making all the fuss! Is it too much to ask for a NON-SMOKING room while staying. I won't recommend to friend.
reviews.title: Ibis City Stopera-great hotel

likes.disliked: — no plug sockets near the mirror!

reviews.text: My boyfriend and myself have just returned from a weekend in Amsterdam and had a great time. the ibis city stopera was a great hotel. basic but very clean,pleasant staff who were all very efficient. the room was clean, towels and bedding changed daily. the shower was bril! 5-10mins walk into dam square so perfect location, our room overlooked canal which was lovely! i would certainly recommend this hotel and would stay in an Ibis again!
reviews.title: A good deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location in a quiet part of town. Service was very good. It's a typical Ibis Hotel nothing fancy but clean and good value. We got a good deal on a triple room. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: Recomend -

likes.disliked: — internet too expensive ! bfst too expensive

reviews.text: Great location, 5 blocks from downtown. Supermarket 1 block, clean, safe, tied, room ok, bathroom bit small. We liked and would stay there again. AMERICANS DON´T FORGET TO BRING a plug to connect your camera charger, notebook (UL to CE), ...., because they have no one to lend you. I bought at AURORA shop paid 5E and lost one day of pics.....
reviews.title: Fabulous view and location

reviews.text: I satyed here for one night and found it easy to find and well positioned. The rooms are functional and basic. The shower room is one of the plastic modules...everything is integrated. It worked fine. Typical Ibis but I have seen other Ibis hotels with better and more spacious reception areas for example. This one has the feel of a hostel!!!
reviews.title: Basic and in a good location

reviews.text: Like all hotels in Amsterdam this one is over-priced by at least 50% compared to what you can get in Cologne/Koln, Luembourg or Brussels.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.text: I stayed IN THIthis weekend. A walking distance from Centraal. Very clean and well located. Free wi-fi, nice staff, Only complaint, I couldn't get an English TV channel. Food a bit pricey!
reviews.title: a good quality hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel over the weekend. The first thing I noticed was that it wasnt far away from the central station. You can actually walk from the station to the hotel.It wouldnt take more then 15-20 minutes.
reviews.title: Really good base

reviews.text: stayed at the hotel from the 12th of june until the 15th. everything about the hotel was well above average. our room was ready when we arrived at 8 am and we were allowed to check in. room was in the back overlooking the water. it was lovely and thankfully, air-conditioned. There was a heat wave in Amsterdam and the temperatures were in the 80's. the hotel made sure we had 2 separate beds as requested. The bedding and the shower was wonderful. The staff, I cannot say enough about. These young men and women were so patient with everyone. They made all kinds of calls for us to get reservations in certain restaurants. Circled maps for us detailing the way for us to get to anywhere we wanted to go. Never rushing anyone that was waiting to ask questions or check in or out. My sister-in-law had a knee problem and every night when we came back to the hotel we stopped at the bar for ice. They were always accommodating. The hotel was very busy at this time with people watching the world cup in the restaurant and bar. but they never made you feel as though you were a nusance to them. We knew when we booked this hotel that it was kind of an economy hotel. Other than not luxury bath items or large closets, or coffee making equipment in the room, the staff, location, cleanliness, air -conditioning, more than make up for these other things. I would love to visit Amsterdam again and once more stay at this hotel. Thanks to everyone who wrote reviews before we finally booked. The hotel was recommended to us by someone who lives and works in Amsterdam, and judges hotels by american standards.
reviews.title: great experience at ibis stopera

reviews.text: We stayed in the Ibis City Stopera from 19-21 May and once we got our bearings, realised we couldn't have booked a hotel in a better location. All areas are accessible either by tram, foot or water taxi and is in a quiet area. The rooms are not huge but I've seen smaller but they are spotless, with one of the most comfortable beds I've stayed in (and you get a quilt !!) The shower takes up most of the space in the bathroom. It's huge, it's also the best shower I've ever had (even better than the one at home). Staff are very friendly and offer a city map and general advice when checking in. Breakfast was listed as "American breakfast" and there was ample to choose from. Cereals, different breads, toast, cooked breakfast, cheese, meat, juices. We arrived earlier than check in and left later than check out and they provide storage space for cases. Regarding previous comments about the hotel being too noisy. Yes, we heard people walking down the corridors, yes we heard other guests doors closing but I've never been to a hotel and not heard such noises. The hotel was full and not everyone goes to bed at the same time so its expected!!! Do I have anything negative to say about the hotel? No it was perfect. Would I stay there again? Definately.
reviews.title: Excellent accommodation

reviews.text: ibis hotel as expected always exceeds the hotel guests expectations. we went there to spend my birthday. as expected the rooms were exactly the same ibis rooms i have been to, the room that we had a very nice canal view in the back portion of the hotel area. There are a few things if only are present could have boost my ratings further such as the following: more nearby convenience stores(despite there is a nearby grocery store), tram or bus transports in front of the hotel(because you have to walk a bit further from the hotel to reach waterlooplein metro and tram stations), nearby affordable restaurants and food shops. But overall this hotel is by far good in terms of practicality, affordability and money for value hotel and clean. The staff were very accomdating before i forget. I will come back again to this hotel if ever i come back again to the beautiful city of AMSTERDAM.
reviews.title: practical and affordable
Clean, modern, and well priced
reviews.text: OK... Here it is- I'll get to the main points...

reviews.title: Noisy
reviews.text: 1. The hotel is actuallly on a very quiet street. Not far from major attractions but far enough that you can't hear commotion.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very good 3 star hotel located in the center of Amsterdam. It is a typical Ibis, similar to other Ibis hotels around the globe.
reviews.title: Great affordable place in pricey Amsterdam!

reviews.text: Room: The room was big in European standards. The bed was ok and the sheets were very clean. The TV had about 30 channels (5 English speaking channels). The bathroom was pretty small, but the shower was big. Bathroom and room were very clean.
reviews.title: Fab Hotel!!

likes.disliked: — no tea or coffee in the rooms

reviews.title: All good
reviews.text: Service: The entire staff speaks English. They were all very polite and nice. Check in and check out were a breeze.
Location: The location is perfect. It is located in the old Jewish area of amsterdam. It is a 5 minute walk to the Rembrandt house, 5 minutes to Waterlooplein and 10 minutes to Rembrandtsplein.
reviews.title: Great Value Modern Hotel

likes.disliked: — It could have been a little closer to the center, but it really wasn't an issue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Price: A double romm per nighet costs (at this time of the year) about 90 Euros. This is one of the cheapest 3 star hotels in central Amsterdam, and surely one of the best of them.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed here for 2 nights over a mid August weekend. Check-in was excellent and we got access to our rooms straight away (despite it being 10.30 am). The rooms are small but perfectly adequate. Hotel and room were clean. The staff were great; very friendly and would do anything to help.
reviews.title: fantastic experience

reviews.text: At an almost perfect location (5-10 minute walk from town center) but a little too far from public transport in my opinion, to be considered really in the center, very helpful staff, not a huge hotel.
reviews.title: Ibis Stopera - good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Problems - lack of ventilation in bathrooms (sometimes you just didn't want to go in there). The room was a little small - we took a room with 3 beds, and it had no floor, just beds... the room with 2 beds was the same size.
reviews.title: Brilliant experience at Stopera

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our first time to Stopera, which is less than 10minutes walk from the Tram station Waterlooplein. Might seem far but once you have done it once, its actually very near. In fact, Amsterdam Centraal is walkable if necessary. Fantastic staff, very helpful from everyone we met throughout the stay. Place is clean, well kept and friendly environment. Will definitely stay there again when I go back to amsterdam and recommend it to all.
reviews.title: Our stay at the Ibis

reviews.text: Journey
reviews.title: Good well located hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travelled to Amsterdam with Easyjet from Stansted. Flight was 50 minutes each way. Transferred to Amsterdam Central on a train from the airport - it costs 3 euro 60 cents for a single, but be aware that most ticket machines only accept Credit or Maestro cards. You also need to validate the ticket by stamping it at the entrance to the platform.
reviews.title: Not Great by Any Means

reviews.text: The walk to the hotel took about 15 minutes from Amsterdam Central station - you can either follow the main road to the left when emerging from the station, or proceed through town, skirting the red light district and on past Waterlooplein to get there.
reviews.title: Clean & convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel
reviews.title: OK but nothing special
Ideal, Clean and Friendly
reviews.text: We arrived mid morning and requested quiet rooms at the rear which we were allocated. However, we could not get the access cards until after 2pm as the rooms were being cleaned. There is a luggage storage room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a pretty decent rate of 99 Euros a night( 141 Euros for the weekends), which isn't bad for Amsterdam since hotels that close into town seem to be pricey.
reviews.title: Outstanding A Real Gem

reviews.text: The hotel was clean and easily accessible. But dont get it mistaken, it is a no frills hotel. The walls are very thin so I was woken every morning by the sounds of the staff cleaning in the hallways. This was usually between 10 and 10:30 so if you don't sleep in late, its not a problem. The beds were nicely designed, but were very hard and I had a bit of trouble sleeping on them. Not a deal breaker but should be noted. The bathrooms very very compact but surprisingly since they were designed so well, you didn't notice.
reviews.title: ibis stopera

likes.disliked: — room a little too small for 3 people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast, well, it was included and it was pretty bad. I am usually not picky with eating, especially when its free, but to put it bluntly, I only ate there once and then bought breakfast from then on at outdoor restaurants.
reviews.title: overpriced

reviews.text: There is Internet access but you have to pay for a pre-paid card.
reviews.title: diissapointed

likes.disliked: — unhelpful reception staff, no tea or coffee facilities, no hair dryer, third bed to small

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights, paid 79euros a night, which is excellent value for Amsterdam. Clean, modern and decent location. This was a football trip so it was ideal for a big party of blokes, if it was me and the wife, I would probably choose one of the small family run hotels, were you get a little bit more of the true Amsterdam. But this was ideal for this trip, easy to get to all the attractions and tram stop 2 minutes away on foot.
reviews.title: Good clean hotel

likes.disliked: — Maintaince men started a bit early in hotel

reviews.text: Spent one night at the hotel with my wife. The room is neither luxurious nor large, and the bathroom is also small, but the hotel and room were new, very clean and larger than some we had seen on the internet, judging by the photos. It even had a nice view of one small charming canal.
reviews.title: Ok location, great hotel

likes.disliked: — Not so close to the center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was also very polite and helpful. This hotel is not so well located as the Centraal Station Ibis, but is close to the metro and you get very fast to the heart of the city. Really enjoyed the hotel, the rate was 89 euros.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — The shower room and general accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ibis hotel chain are generally very good value for money and this hotel was no exception. The hotel is immaculate, the staff always friendly and helpful, the rooms spotless and the restaurant serves nice food and drink.
reviews.title: Ibis is OK

likes.disliked: — No bath or tea making facilities in the room

description: The Ibis Amsterdam City Stopera hotel is ideally located in the city centre, a few minutes from the Stopera Opera House, Dam Square, Rembrandtplein and Waterlooplein. Easily accessible by public transport or by car.
